item.title: A truffle for 1578669643095
item.description:
Comment: I tried putting these things in my oatmeal this morning, really like how it turned out!

Ingredients:

  • Egg
  • Vanilla extract
  • Brown sugar
  • Cinnamon
  • Oat milk (after cooking)

Things you won't say at the end of your life:

  • I wish I didn't tip people as much

item.title: A truffle for 1561233520183
item.description:
Comment: This is a concept that has been rolling around in my head for a while now. It's not my best writing, but I've realized I need to get into the habit of just publishing what I have and getting it out there.

Blog post: https://blog.jlleblanc.com/subscribe-to-my-channel-saving-the-web-by-turning-it-inside-out

Concept: Personal information channel

item.title: A truffle for 1559312581340

hostId: 045492ad-182d-4682-b520-3c69fd0e31d6

Ways we are tracked:

  • Clicks
  • Email addresses
  • Phone numbers
  • Location
  • Payment methods

item.title: A truffle for 1559311821062
item.description: Comment: We've spent the last 25+ years of the web being tracked by cookies. It's time to turn the paradigm around to where we're tracking what we're sending the web.

item.title: A truffle for 1558618123031
item.description: Comment: Today, I powered down and deleted my hobby server. It's served me well for the past year, but I've come to realize it's been time to pull the plug for a while now. One reason is that in this season of my life, I don't have the time for hobby projects that I once did. It requires both time and focus... I usually don't have both at the same time these days. But beyond that reason, I feel that maybe I've outgrown the need for the server in the first place. I spun it up while I was looking for something new: a new framework, a new job, and (I now realize in retrospect) a new perspective on who I am and what I'm doing in this world. I hesitated as I hovered over the "Delete" button, but I clicked it knowing that sometimes you have to finish a chapter so you can get started on the next one.

item.title: A truffle for 1557239531255
item.description: Observation: Relationships don't scale. Treating them as though they are is what leads to so many problems we see today.

item.title: A truffle for 1552400391883
item.description:
Comment: In an otherwise gloomy article, I'm heartened by the anecdote about the first web server being powered off over Christmas, despite Sir Tim Berners-Lee's efforts to prevent it from happening!

Happy Birthday: World Wide Web

Link: https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-47524474

item.title: A truffle for 1551798060210
item.description:
Comment: When I look at a new framework or language, I want to start with an easy example to get started. But "hello world" and "Todo MVC" are usually not enough. I'm looking for something more like what this is to fonts: something that shows as much potential as possible in a glance.

Example: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

item.title: A truffle for 1551057556798
item.description:
Observation: Since getting off social media, I've been taking fewer photos. I have to admit, that does mean I'm telling fewer stories.

Comment: Perhaps I need to commit to taking more photos, regardless of whether I post them or not.
